author: WSJ Staff
title: Special Counsel’s Office Files Criminal Charges Against Alex Van Der Zwaan - WSJ
text:
A lawyer accused of lying to Special Counsel Robert Mueller pleaded guilty Tuesday, in the latest indication Mr. Mueller’s investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election is picking up speed.
Alex van der Zwaan, a former associate at the law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom LLP, admitted he lied about his contact with Richard Gates, a former adviser to President Donald Trump, in a November interview with the special counsel’s office.
... RELATED VIDEO What People Really Mean When They Say 'Collusion' When it comes to the Russia investigation, the word "Collusion" gets thrown around a lot. But there's not a lot of clarity on what it actually means. Is it illegal? Is it grounds for impeachment? We asked a law professor to explain. Photo Illustration: Drew Evans/The Wall Street Journal.
